bioHeader: Software Engineer based in Scottsdale, AZ
bio: I am an experienced Software Engineer and Android Developer, with previous experience as an athlete, and have a passion for innovation and a strong drive for continuous improvement in all of my endeavors. I'm currently reading and diving more into Machine Learning and AI, and I'm looking forward to applying what I'm learning on my next projects.

workExperience.name: Toast
description: Android Engineer. Member of the Payments Experience team. Responsible for implementing new features, updating existing payment functionalities, and fixing bugs within the Toast point of sale (POS) application.

workExperience.name: eRetailing
description: Designed and developed an in-house Android application for the Zebra MC40 scanners using Java and Android Studio for the front-end, and Perl, SQL, and Firebase for the backend. The application uses different web transactions to help the production team with warehouse management tasks. These tasks involve: assign, locate, identify, pick, put away, receive, transfer, print, among others. The goal is to make the warehouse become paperless, the order workflow more efficient, and inventory 100% accurate.
Communicated directly with employees to gather requirements and to get feedback from the application, as well as their desired additional functionalities.

workExperience.name: Vyra
description: My friends and I attempted to innovate the interviewing process for software engineers. We used React JS for the front-end and Node JS, Express, MySQL, and AWS for the back-end to build a web application that allowed interviewers and interviewees to have a more realistic interview experience. The application included a built-in calendar, dashboard, candidate management tools (favorites, position, etc.), real-time screen share, real-time note-taking, among other features.

technicalProjects.name: Resume App
technicalProjects.description: Why not have a website as a resume? Simple React JS app that includes some of the projects I have worked on (pulled directly from GitHub), a quick section about myself, and of course, my resume information.

technicalProjects.name: Countries App
technicalProjects.description: Basic Android application that covers all the modern Android development patterns in Java. This includes: MVVM architecture, Lifecycle Extensions, Dagger2, RxJava, Retrofit, Glide, and some simple Unit Testing.

technicalProjects.name: DevConnector
technicalProjects.description: An in-depth full-stack social network application for developers. The tech stack I used includes Node.js, Express, React, Redux, and MongoDB along with ES6+.

technicalProjects.name: Pokemon App
technicalProjects.description: Very very simple React Pokemon application using the latest features of React. It utilizes hooks for state and effects instead of classes, and also basic pagination.

technicalProjects.name: Homeowner Buddy
technicalProjects.description: A cross-platform mobile app which interacts directly with the web app. The mobile app allows Habitat Mid-Ohio homeowners to search for a tutorial video on how to solve a particular home issue they might have. My team and I used Xamarin Forms, REST architecture, and C# to implement the app.

intercollegiateAthletics.name: Ohio State University DI Varsity Men's Swimming and Diving Team
accolades: 2nd place at Men’s 100y Backstroke at 2019 Big Ten Men’s Swimming and Diving Championships
Recipient of the 2018 Ohio State University Swimming & Diving Carl Wirthwein Award (Most Improved Swimmer)
Placed 6 th in the 100m Butterfly at 2015 FINA World Junior Swimming Championships

leadershipActivities.name: Design, Develop, Deploy (D3)
leadershipActivities.description: Collaboratively worked on a team to develop a platform that will change the way technical interviews work in the tech world.
